title: SWE Engineer Technical Rubric

dimensions.name: communication
dimensions.description: Clarity, structure, and ability to articulate trade-offs.

levels.description: Unclear narrative, missing steps, hard to follow.
Explains key steps but lacks structure or precision.
Clear, structured explanation with good trade-off discussion.
Concise, polished explanation with strong technical clarity.

dimensions.name: problem_solving
dimensions.description: Ability to frame the problem, choose strategies, and adapt under constraints.

levels.description: Weak framing or incorrect approach.
Reasonable approach but limited optimization or alternatives.
Solid strategy with trade-offs and optimization awareness.
Elegant, scalable approach with strong insight and adaptability.

dimensions.name: correctness_reasoning
dimensions.description: Soundness of reasoning, invariants, and proof of correctness.

levels.description: Incorrect or lacks reasoning.
Some reasoning but incomplete or shaky.
Clear correctness reasoning with key invariants.
Rigorous, complete, and convincing proof.

dimensions.name: complexity
dimensions.description: Accuracy of time/space analysis and optimization decisions.

levels.description: Missing or incorrect analysis.
Basic analysis with minor errors or omissions.
Accurate analysis with reasonable optimization choices.
Thorough analysis with strong optimization and scalability.

dimensions.name: edge_cases
dimensions.description: Identification and handling of edge cases, constraints, and failures.

levels.description: Misses critical edge cases or constraints.
Covers some edge cases, incomplete handling.
Covers major edge cases and constraints well.
Comprehensive coverage and robust handling.

overall_scoring: Compute the overall score as the average of the five dimension scores, scaled to 0-100 and rounded.
